translated: Birth Stories
The Fives🔽The Chapter with Short Stories
The Golden Deer
“Try, try, you with the horse’s feet,
try, try, you great deer!
Break the noose that’s around your neck,
I don’t enjoy the forest alone.”
“I try, but I can’t get out;
I stumble and fall.
The noose is strong and tight,
and it’s cutting into my foot.”
“Pull out the grass, hunter,
and put away your sword.
Kill me first,
and then kill the great deer.”

analyzed: na me sutam vā diṭṭham vā
translated: “I’ve never heard or seen
a deer speaking in human speech.
May you be happy, good lady,
and may this great deer.”
“Hunter, rejoice
with all your relatives,
just as I rejoice today
at seeing the great deer set free.”
The Golden Deer Birth Story is the ninth.
